summary: i know that you have big love for tony stark, but what are you're opinions on steve? do you like him, feel indifferent, or hate...
question: i know that you have big love for tony stark, but what are you're opinions on steve? do you like him, feel indifferent, or hate him like (unfortunatly a lot of) tony stans? im just curious. i love tony, but also steve and its hard when there are so many antis out there
answer: I like Steve for the most part 😊 I heavily disagreed with his actions in Civil War and the ending the writers game him in Endgame but yeah 💖 I also ship Stony so I think him and Tony together is just great (I mostly read fics from before Civil War though because I feel like their relationship is really toxic afterwards)

summary: A/n: Ok, so this is kinda sorta how I imagined Pepper went about telling Tony that she was pregnant. (I changed it to x reader...
body:
Finding out

A/n: Ok, so this is kinda sorta how I imagined Pepper went about telling Tony that she was pregnant. (I changed it to x reader tho) And I KNOW that they left to kill Thanos the next day Tony came back, but for the story sake, pretend it was about 2 weeks later.

Also, writing this I thought about how that call Pepper made to Tony when he got on the ship was her desperately trying to get him back because she just found out she was pregnant. I almost wanna write her point of view as soon as Tony leaves with Strange.

I was so relieved to watch Tony walk down from those steps of that ship. So relieved to hear his voice, to feel him embrace again after a long terrifying 22 days. More or less, I was relieved our little baby was gonna have their father.

Tony has yet to find out though. It’s been two weeks since he returned and I have been nursing him back to health with Bruce. I wanted to tell him when he wasn’t so near death and a pile of bones.

I sat with Tony in the physical therapy room, helping Tony do some stretching. The lack of food and malnutrition caused his muscles to get really weak, but after all of this physical therapy, he’s been able to walk on his own and his muscle is rebuilding well.

The baby bumb was already starting to form, and I don’t know if Tony had nessicarlly even noticed. But I wore a sweater in attempt to hide it as well as I could.

“Okay, I wanna try lifting the 15 pound dumbbell.” Tony says standing up. “Woahhh there, trying to get shredded or what?” I tease. He smirks and rolls his eyes. 15lbs is a big deal in our book, considering he couldn’t lift a full pound when he got home. He picked it up with very little struggle and curled it a few times.

He looked over at me and winked and flexed making me chuckle. I watch him for a few moments and realize this is a good time. “Tony, we need to talk.” I say. Tony puts down the dumbbell and quirks his brow. “That’s never good.” He mumbles, walking back towards me on the bench.

I laugh softly and shake my head. “I think this might be the one good thing in our life.” I say with a small smile. Tony, still with a look of confusion, sits down besides me and takes my hand and gives it a small squeeze. “What’s up honey?” Tony says, his voice as smooth as the nickname.

“Tony, remember the day you went into space, when we went to the park.” I start off. “How could I forget? It was the worse day of my life getting my ass handed to me on a platter.” Tony mumbles, looking down. I give him a small frown and squeeze his hand. “Before, everyone, got their ass handed to them. Our conversation in the park, remember?” I say.

Tony looks up at, his soft brown eyes locking with mine. “A-about my dream?” He whispers. “Well, after you left. I decided to go see. I went to the store and bought a test, took it, and whatcha know, you’re psych.” I say, a small smile tugging at my lips. “That’s why I tried to call you and our call was dropped.” I whisper. Tony’s eyes fill with tears.

I gently lay my hand against Tony’s cheek, my thumb whipping away some of the tears that spilled out. “Oh Y/n, I-I’m so sorry, I should’ve c-came ho-” “No. No don’t do that Tony. It doesn’t matter. What matter is your here, alive, with me, and our baby.” I cut him off. Tony smiles, some tears still stained on his cheeks. He turns his head in my hand and kisses my palm. Then leaning forward, placing his soft lips onto mine.

He pulls away, a big grin still on his face. He leans down and lifts up my shirt, admiring my small bump. “Hi sweetheart, this is your daddy. I promise I’m gonna take such good care of you, such, such good care of you.” He whispers the last part, placing a soft kiss on my stomach.

I smile down at him, running my hands through his brown hair. “Ya know, it still could be a boy.” I say, tears of my own welling in my eyes. “Well my dream has been right so far, little Morgan, my sweetie wee.” He says, placing another kiss on the bump.

He sits up, pulling my sweater back down and pulls me into his arms. “I love you Y/n.” Tony says. “I love you too To-”

I’m cut off when Steve comes walking into the door. “Tony.” He says. Tony pulls away, lightly grimacing at me before turning around to face Steve. “Cap.” He says. “Tony we found Thanos, we are leaving right now, you coming?” He says. Worry hits me hard. I bite my lip to keep from crying, though my eyes sting.

I don’t wanna be the one to stop Tony from being a hero, but god the thought of him leaving me and almost dying again hurts so bad. I sigh and hold my head down, knowing there is no point in trying to stop Tony, since he always wants to go towards the fight. It’s embedded in him.

“No.” Tony’s voice says. I look up, tears filling my eyes again. “What? Tony this is our only cha- "I said no Cap. I am not joining this fight anymore. I already fought the fight, I won’t go back.” Tony says standing up. He turns around and gently takes my hand, making me stand up besides him. “Not when I have everything right here.” He whispers, his arm sliding behind my back along my waist.

Steve scoffs and walks away. Tony turns and looks at me, his hand cupping my cheeks, wiping way the tears that had slipped. “I am never leaving you again Y/n, you, or our little Morgan, I promise.” He whispers. I nod, a soft sob escaping my lips. I wrapped my arms around him and he did then same, kissing my head lightly.

title: itchy feet and fading smiles
body:
read it on the AO3 at http://bit.ly/2Wx1w2F

by sturwurstrash

The tears were what got him, reminding Tony of that day. The day he worked tirelessly for seven months to reverse. The only other time, up until now, he had seen Peter cry. Had seen him this terrified. Tony had to remind himself that Peter wasn’t ash stuck in between his fingernails anymore. That he was a living, breathing person. A person who was currently hyperventilating from a panic attack in a back alley in Queens.
–
Tony realizes just how much Peter means to him, and how much it would hurt if he was gone for good.

summary:
Requested by @fangirlsarah16 
“[Y/N]?” Peter whispered, as he climbed through your bedroom window. To your boyfriend’s great...
body:
Requested by @fangirlsarah16

“[Y/N]?” Peter whispered, as he climbed through your bedroom window. To your boyfriend’s great dismay you weren’t in their at the moment. No matter, he’s just do what he always did if you weren’t in your room when he arrived. With a shrug Peter walked toward your closet, he stayed in there whenever he had to wait for you so your father Tony Stark himself wouldn’t catch him. However, Peter would be met with an unexpected surprise when you opened the closet door.

Before he could even think, Peter was met with a robot. “Woah, what the-“ But he would be allowed to finish his sentence because all of a sudden that same robot blasted him backwards towards the still open window. He would have gone flying outside if a hand didn’t reach out and grab him before he went soaring outside. Still breathing heavily with shock, Peter looked up and saw that you had successfully saved him.

The most apologetic look was on your face as you helped in secure his footing. “I’m so sorry, dad found out that you’ve been hiding out in my closet so he built that robot to make sure you couldn’t do it anymore” you explained, cheeks heating up with embarrassment. Then you turned to the robot and shouted an order. “Go back in the closet Peter-Be-Gone-Suit”.

“Peter-be-what now?” Peter blinked in disbelief. Thankfully at your words the robot did return to it’s place. “What are we going to do now?” Peter continued.

You shrugged miserably at this. “I don’t know but we’re not going to let dad get in the way for long. We’ll figure something out, we always do”.

REQUESTS ARE OPEN

body:
Operation: Date Night

“Pete…hand me that wrench would you?” Tony holds his hand out while he pokes at some build-up with a flathead screwdriver, but when the familiar weight of metal isn’t placed in his hand right away, he looks up. “Peter?”

Said teen gasps loudly as he snaps his head upright from his unexpected nap, and he hurriedly gathers his papers and notebooks together. “Sorry Dad! Just meant to rest my eyes for a second!” Before Tony can say anything, Peter looks at his watch. “Look at the time! It’s super late! Going to bed! Night!”

The boy nearly flies out of the lab and past a now entering Stephen with a quick ‘Night Mom!’, and leaves both parents looking baffled. The sorcerer recovers first and enters the room, leaving the door to slide shut behind him, and he takes Peter’s previously occupied spot. Tony took a little while longer to recover. Peter had been acting weird and it was always like pulling teeth when it came to getting the boy out of the lab for the night. He went willingly this time though.  As if he was hiding something. Tony knew those papers weren’t homework, but it was likely just new upgrade ideas for their suits or even new web formulas.

Of course, Peter tended to leave those ideas in the lab.

“That wasn’t some really convincing copy of our son was it?” Tony finally asks.

Stephen furrows his brows. “No. He has been acting strange though. I walked into his room earlier this afternoon to ask him what he wanted for lunch and he slammed his laptop closed. You know what he said?”

Tony shrugs, grabs the wanted wrench off the worktable, and returns to his project. “Chicken salad?”

“Porn.”

“Huh. That’s not what he usually wan–wait. What?!” Tony looks over at his husband with bewilderment.

“I think he thought I asked what he was doing.”

“If that isn’t a huge red flag telling us he’s doing something he’s not supposed to, I don’t know what is.”

It only got weirder.

Peter moved on from suspicious activities to constantly hounding them about something or another. Like favorite foods or favorite music. Stephen eventually came to the assumption that the teen had to do an essay of some sort about his parents but was too embarrassed to say anything, but Tony nixed that. The genius said Peter would have fun with an essay like that, but any problems about it would be at school with students who still didn’t quite believe he was actually adopted by two Avengers.

Nevermind that there was a whole news story about it that ran for two months. It only ran so long because everyone had to put in their two cents about Tony’s ability to parent properly and keep Peter safe. Yes, it was hard sometimes, mostly because the safe part was hard when Peter put himself in danger every night because he was Spiderman, but Tony made him a suit. Actual parenting? At least if Peter drove him up the wall, he could pawn him off on Stephen. He could switch to Mama Bear so fast and the teen had a love/hate relationship with the sorcerer’s 'maternal’ side.

He loved when it wasn’t directed at him.

He hated it when it was.

Unless of course snuggling was involved, then one would need to get a crowbar to separate the two.

“What are you two doing tonight?” Peter asks a couple of days later.

Tony and Stephen look up at him from their respective beverages across the island counter before the mechanic shrugs.

“Probably just going to order take-out and watch a movie.”

“Oh! Well in that case–”

“Boss.” Friday interrupts. “There are a group of people running around the city with alien tech. I’ve detected that they’ve planted a few power cores already as well.”

Tony groans. “Hold that thought Peter.”

Of course, they never got back to the conversation. By the time they took care of the 'crazy people with alien guns’ (Scott’s words), it was late and they were all too tired to do anything but what Tony originally planned. They ordered take-out, watched a movie while they ate, and then retired for bed.

Peter tried again the next morning but Stephen shook his head. “I have to check on the Sanctums and go to Kamar-Taj for a couple of days. Maybe more if the other masters have something for me to deal with.”

And that was that. Stephen left through a portal and was gone for a week. He came back exhausted and injured, so Peter left him alone until he had healed and rested. That took another week.

The third time Peter was going to ask about their plans, he couldn’t even open his mouth before Tony’s phone was ringing. Stephen did seem to notice the teen’s exasperation though.

“Another meeting? What’s it about this time? A schedule to cough? Pep-”

Peter snatches his father’s phone from him and holds it up to his ear. “He’s busy! Things are already planned!” Both parents stare incredulously at their son while he talks to Pepper. “Yes. No…I told you…okay. Thanks Aunt Pepper.” Peter hangs up and drops the phone in Tony’s lap as he turns toward Stephen. “No sorcerer duties today for you either. I already talked to Wong and he’ll take care of things for the rest of the night.”

Stephen cocks his head. “When did you talk to Wong?”

“Uh…the more important question would be what the fuck?” Tony says.

Peter only smiles at them. “Go get dressed. Something not too fancy but not too casual either.”

Both men stand and the teen pushes them toward their bedroom, and then to the elevator once they come out dressed accordingly. They both chose dress shirts (Tony wore a dark red, and Stephen a dark blue) and black slacks, and to Peter’s satisfaction, left the ties behind.

Now they were just trying to figure out what was going on.

“Peter, if you wanted to go do something you just needed to ask.” Tony says.

“Oh. It’s not for me. It’s for you two.” He shoves them into the elevator and grins. “Have fun on your date! To the garage Friday!”

Tony and Stephen stare at the doors of the elevator when they close and then look at each other. Their kid planned a date night for them? They stand in stunned silence as the elevator descends to the garage floor, and when the elevator doors open, they find Happy standing against one of Tony’s cars.

Tony points at him. “You’re in on it too?!”

“So is Pepper. She made reservations for dinner. You’ve got a good kid.”

“She called me about a meeting!”

“Yeah, that was planned. She knew you would complain and that was Peter’s signal to take the phone and make sure everything was ready.” Happy opens the back door and Tony slides in while Stephen hesitates. “Peter asked me to drive extra careful for you.”

Stephen smiles softly. The teen even thought of the sorcerer’s unease with driving. “Of course he did.”

He climbs in next to Tony and the driver closes the door before getting into the front seat. “I’ll put up the divider so you don’t scar me for life.”

Tony grins. “You know what that means Stephanie?”

Stephen smirks. “We have to be extra loud.”

Happy rolls his eyes and the last thing they hear before the divider closes is a mumbled, “I hate you guys.”

“Yeah, that was planned. She knew you would complain and that was Peter’s signal to take the phone and make sure everything was ready.” Happy opens the back door and Tony slides in while Stephen hesitates. “Peter asked me to drive extra careful for you.”

Stephen smiles softly. The teen even thought of the sorcerer’s unease with driving. “Of course he did.”

He climbs in next to Tony and the driver closes the door before getting into the front seat. “I’ll put up the divider so you don’t scar me for life.”

Tony grins. “You know what that means Stephanie?”

Stephen smirks. “We have to be extra loud.”

Happy rolls his eyes and the last thing they hear before the divider closes is a mumbled, “I hate you guys.”

trail.content_raw:
Operation: Date Night

“Pete…hand me that wrench would you?” Tony holds his hand out while he pokes at some build-up with a flathead screwdriver, but when the familiar weight of metal isn’t placed in his hand right away, he looks up. “Peter?”

Said teen gasps loudly as he snaps his head upright from his unexpected nap, and he hurriedly gathers his papers and notebooks together. “Sorry Dad! Just meant to rest my eyes for a second!” Before Tony can say anything, Peter looks at his watch. “Look at the time! It’s super late! Going to bed! Night!”

The boy nearly flies out of the lab and past a now entering Stephen with a quick ‘Night Mom!’, and leaves both parents looking baffled. The sorcerer recovers first and enters the room, leaving the door to slide shut behind him, and he takes Peter’s previously occupied spot. Tony took a little while longer to recover. Peter had been acting weird and it was always like pulling teeth when it came to getting the boy out of the lab for the night. He went willingly this time though.  As if he was hiding something. Tony knew those papers weren’t homework, but it was likely just new upgrade ideas for their suits or even new web formulas.

Of course, Peter tended to leave those ideas in the lab.

“That wasn’t some really convincing copy of our son was it?” Tony finally asks.

Stephen furrows his brows. “No. He has been acting strange though. I walked into his room earlier this afternoon to ask him what he wanted for lunch and he slammed his laptop closed. You know what he said?”

Tony shrugs, grabs the wanted wrench off the worktable, and returns to his project. “Chicken salad?”

“Porn.”

“Huh. That’s not what he usually wan–wait. What?!” Tony looks over at his husband with bewilderment.

“I think he thought I asked what he was doing.”

“If that isn’t a huge red flag telling us he’s doing something he’s not supposed to, I don’t know what is.”

It only got weirder.

Peter moved on from suspicious activities to constantly hounding them about something or another. Like favorite foods or favorite music. Stephen eventually came to the assumption that the teen had to do an essay of some sort about his parents but was too embarrassed to say anything, but Tony nixed that. The genius said Peter would have fun with an essay like that, but any problems about it would be at school with students who still didn’t quite believe he was actually adopted by two Avengers.

Nevermind that there was a whole news story about it that ran for two months. It only ran so long because everyone had to put in their two cents about Tony’s ability to parent properly and keep Peter safe. Yes, it was hard sometimes, mostly because the safe part was hard when Peter put himself in danger every night because he was Spiderman, but Tony made him a suit. Actual parenting? At least if Peter drove him up the wall, he could pawn him off on Stephen. He could switch to Mama Bear so fast and the teen had a love/hate relationship with the sorcerer’s 'maternal’ side.

He loved when it wasn’t directed at him.

He hated it when it was.

Unless of course snuggling was involved, then one would need to get a crowbar to separate the two.

“What are you two doing tonight?” Peter asks a couple of days later.

Tony and Stephen look up at him from their respective beverages across the island counter before the mechanic shrugs.

“Probably just going to order take-out and watch a movie.”

“Oh! Well in that case–”

“Boss.” Friday interrupts. “There are a group of people running around the city with alien tech. I’ve detected that they’ve planted a few power cores already as well.”

Tony groans. “Hold that thought Peter.”

Of course, they never got back to the conversation. By the time they took care of the 'crazy people with alien guns’ (Scott’s words), it was late and they were all too tired to do anything but what Tony originally planned. They ordered take-out, watched a movie while they ate, and then retired for bed.

Peter tried again the next morning but Stephen shook his head. “I have to check on the Sanctums and go to Kamar-Taj for a couple of days. Maybe more if the other masters have something for me to deal with.”

And that was that. Stephen left through a portal and was gone for a week. He came back exhausted and injured, so Peter left him alone until he had healed and rested. That took another week.

The third time Peter was going to ask about their plans, he couldn’t even open his mouth before Tony’s phone was ringing. Stephen did seem to notice the teen’s exasperation though.

“Another meeting? What’s it about this time? A schedule to cough? Pep-”

Peter snatches his father’s phone from him and holds it up to his ear. “He’s busy! Things are already planned!” Both parents stare incredulously at their son while he talks to Pepper. “Yes. No…I told you…okay. Thanks Aunt Pepper.” Peter hangs up and drops the phone in Tony’s lap as he turns toward Stephen. “No sorcerer duties today for you either. I already talked to Wong and he’ll take care of things for the rest of the night.”

Stephen cocks his head. “When did you talk to Wong?”

“Uh…the more important question would be what the fuck?” Tony says.

Peter only smiles at them. “Go get dressed. Something not too fancy but not too casual either.”

Both men stand and the teen pushes them toward their bedroom, and then to the elevator once they come out dressed accordingly. They both chose dress shirts (Tony wore a dark red, and Stephen a dark blue) and black slacks, and to Peter’s satisfaction, left the ties behind.

Now they were just trying to figure out what was going on.

“Peter, if you wanted to go do something you just needed to ask.” Tony says.

“Oh. It’s not for me. It’s for you two.” He shoves them into the elevator and grins. “Have fun on your date! To the garage Friday!”

Tony and Stephen stare at the doors of the elevator when they close and then look at each other. Their kid planned a date night for them? They stand in stunned silence as the elevator descends to the garage floor, and when the elevator doors open, they find Happy standing against one of Tony’s cars.

Tony points at him. “You’re in on it too?!”

“So is Pepper. She made reservations for dinner. You’ve got a good kid.”

“She called me about a meeting!”

“Yeah, that was planned. She knew you would complain and that was Peter’s signal to take the phone and make sure everything was ready.” Happy opens the back door and Tony slides in while Stephen hesitates. “Peter asked me to drive extra careful for you.”

Stephen smiles softly. The teen even thought of the sorcerer’s unease with driving. “Of course he did.”

He climbs in next to Tony and the driver closes the door before getting into the front seat. “I’ll put up the divider so you don’t scar me for life.”

Tony grins. “You know what that means Stephanie?”

Stephen smirks. “We have to be extra loud.”

Happy rolls his eyes and the last thing they hear before the divider closes is a mumbled, “I hate you guys.”

tags: things i think about a lot
summary:
I've pointed this out to a few people before but--
Tony is the least stable/sensible/okay person on Team Iron Man 
Steve is the...
body:
I’ve pointed this out to a few people before but–

Tony is the least stable/sensible/okay person on Team Iron Man

Steve is the most stable/sensible/okay person on Team Cap

Which sort of shows the difference between them doesn’t it? Steve is okay with responsibility and being relied on and dealing with out of the blue situations, because he’s a soldier. He also improvises a lot, and over the years has adopted more of the “I have a plan: Attack” attitude that Tony used to have, while Tony prefers predictability now. He surrounds himself with people who are loyal, even if they’re not the best at handling things, or struggle to get things going without much resistance.

Tony requires a defense network who he knows he can rely on because they know better than him, will challenge his ideas with constructive criticism, and have the capacity to deal with his issues. He needs to have a hand on the wheel without bearing all of the responsibility, prefering to share it, and as in everything, surrounds himself with people who are tactical and intuitive and most often work a situation to their advantage.

It’s just interesting to think about emotionally and as team construction goes. Team Iron Man exists to carry out a mission with precision and ease and ideally little struggle while Team Cap is a group of people coming together to face unknown challenges with little preparation.

title: Petvengers (Or, how Peter tricks NY heroes into pet adoption)
body:
read it on the AO3 at http://bit.ly/2ZmFooX

by Lurafita

Kind of a follow up to ‘The wounds we see (and the scars we don’t), but only in the way that all stories in the series connect to each other.
This is bordering on crack, seriously. It is a lot of fun to write though. I hope you will enjoy it.

Peter has decided that New York’s heroes should all have (at least one) pet. Because pets are awesome.
Now he just has to convince them of it.
